column4: installed new kernel, 2.6.12...and on boot, it says kernel panic...it didnt make an initrd.img, which i assume is the problem..any help?
You can run mkinitrd by hand, but it's usually better to package your own kernels with make-kpkg
The best answer is really to not do your own kernel, and try to get the generic Ubuntu kernel working.
If you can wait another week or two, breezy should start to settle down enough.
